00123 static void write_history(void);

00125 /* To be able to read files without windows closing, opening, moving
00126  * we try to prepare for worst case:
00127  * - active window gets active screen from file
00128  * - restoring the screens from non-active windows
00129  * Best case is all screens match, in that case they get assigned to proper window
00130  */
00131 static void wm_window_match_init(bContext *C, ListBase *wmlist)
00132 {
00133     wmWindowManager *wm;
00134     wmWindow *win, *active_win;
00135     
00136     *wmlist = G.main->wm;
00137     G.main->wm.first = G.main->wm.last = NULL;
00138     
00139     active_win = CTX_wm_window(C);
00140 
00141     /* first wrap up running stuff */
00142     /* code copied from wm_init_exit.c */
00143     for (wm = wmlist->first; wm; wm = wm->id.next) {
00144         
00145         WM_jobs_stop_all(wm);
00146         
00147         for (win = wm->windows.first; win; win = win->next) {
00148         
00149             CTX_wm_window_set(C, win);  /* needed by operator close callbacks */
00150             WM_event_remove_handlers(C, &win->handlers);
00151             WM_event_remove_handlers(C, &win->modalhandlers);
00152             ED_screen_exit(C, win, win->screen);
00153         }
00154     }
00155     
00156     /* reset active window */
00157     CTX_wm_window_set(C, active_win);
00158 
00159     ED_editors_exit(C);
00160 
00161     /* just had return; here from r12991, this code could just get removed?*/
00162 #if 0
00163     if (wm == NULL) return;
00164     if (G.fileflags & G_FILE_NO_UI) return;
00165     
00166     /* we take apart the used screens from non-active window */
00167     for (win = wm->windows.first; win; win = win->next) {
00168         BLI_strncpy(win->screenname, win->screen->id.name, MAX_ID_NAME);
00169         if (win != wm->winactive) {
00170             BLI_remlink(&G.main->screen, win->screen);
00171             //BLI_addtail(screenbase, win->screen);
00172         }
00173     }
00174 #endif
00175 }
00176 
00177 /* match old WM with new, 4 cases:
00178  * 1- no current wm, no read wm: make new default
00179  * 2- no current wm, but read wm: that's OK, do nothing
00180  * 3- current wm, but not in file: try match screen names
00181  * 4- current wm, and wm in file: try match ghostwin
00182  */
00183 
00184 static void wm_window_match_do(bContext *C, ListBase *oldwmlist)
00185 {
00186     wmWindowManager *oldwm, *wm;
00187     wmWindow *oldwin, *win;
00188     
00189     /* cases 1 and 2 */
00190     if (oldwmlist->first == NULL) {
00191         if (G.main->wm.first) ;  /* nothing todo */
00192         else
00193             wm_add_default(C);
00194     }
00195     else {
00196         /* cases 3 and 4 */
00197         
00198         /* we've read file without wm..., keep current one entirely alive */
00199         if (G.main->wm.first == NULL) {
00200             bScreen *screen = NULL;
00201 
00202             /* when loading without UI, no matching needed */
00203             if (!(G.fileflags & G_FILE_NO_UI) && (screen = CTX_wm_screen(C))) {
00204 
00205                 /* match oldwm to new dbase, only old files */
00206                 for (wm = oldwmlist->first; wm; wm = wm->id.next) {
00207                     
00208                     for (win = wm->windows.first; win; win = win->next) {
00209                         /* all windows get active screen from file */
00210                         if (screen->winid == 0)
00211                             win->screen = screen;
00212                         else 
00213                             win->screen = ED_screen_duplicate(win, screen);
00214                         
00215                         BLI_strncpy(win->screenname, win->screen->id.name + 2, sizeof(win->screenname));
00216                         win->screen->winid = win->winid;
00217                     }
00218                 }
00219             }
00220             
00221             G.main->wm = *oldwmlist;
00222             
00223             /* screens were read from file! */
00224             ED_screens_initialize(G.main->wm.first);
00225         }
00226         else {
00227             /* what if old was 3, and loaded 1? */
00228             /* this code could move to setup_appdata */
00229             oldwm = oldwmlist->first;
00230             wm = G.main->wm.first;
00231 
00232             /* preserve key configurations in new wm, to preserve their keymaps */
00233             wm->keyconfigs = oldwm->keyconfigs;
00234             wm->addonconf = oldwm->addonconf;
00235             wm->defaultconf = oldwm->defaultconf;
00236             wm->userconf = oldwm->userconf;
00237 
00238             oldwm->keyconfigs.first = oldwm->keyconfigs.last = NULL;
00239             oldwm->addonconf = NULL;
00240             oldwm->defaultconf = NULL;
00241             oldwm->userconf = NULL;
00242 
00243             /* ensure making new keymaps and set space types */
00244             wm->initialized = 0;
00245             wm->winactive = NULL;
00246             
00247             /* only first wm in list has ghostwins */
00248             for (win = wm->windows.first; win; win = win->next) {
00249                 for (oldwin = oldwm->windows.first; oldwin; oldwin = oldwin->next) {
00250                     
00251                     if (oldwin->winid == win->winid) {
00252                         win->ghostwin = oldwin->ghostwin;
00253                         win->active = oldwin->active;
00254                         if (win->active)
00255                             wm->winactive = win;
00256 
00257                         if (!G.background) /* file loading in background mode still calls this */
00258                             GHOST_SetWindowUserData(win->ghostwin, win);    /* pointer back */
00259 
00260                         oldwin->ghostwin = NULL;
00261                         
00262                         win->eventstate = oldwin->eventstate;
00263                         oldwin->eventstate = NULL;
00264                         
00265                         /* ensure proper screen rescaling */
00266                         win->sizex = oldwin->sizex;
00267                         win->sizey = oldwin->sizey;
00268                         win->posx = oldwin->posx;
00269                         win->posy = oldwin->posy;
00270                     }
00271                 }
00272             }
00273             wm_close_and_free_all(C, oldwmlist);
00274         }
00275     }
00276 }
00277 
00278 /* in case UserDef was read, we re-initialize all, and do versioning */
00279 static void wm_init_userdef(bContext *C)
00280 {
00281     UI_init_userdef();
00282     MEM_CacheLimiter_set_maximum(((size_t)U.memcachelimit) * 1024 * 1024);
00283     sound_init(CTX_data_main(C));
00284 
00285     /* needed so loading a file from the command line respects user-pref [#26156] */
00286     if (U.flag & USER_FILENOUI) G.fileflags |= G_FILE_NO_UI;
00287     else G.fileflags &= ~G_FILE_NO_UI;
00288 
00289     /* set the python auto-execute setting from user prefs */
00290     /* enabled by default, unless explicitly enabled in the command line which overrides */
00291     if ((G.f & G_SCRIPT_OVERRIDE_PREF) == 0) {
00292         if ((U.flag & USER_SCRIPT_AUTOEXEC_DISABLE) == 0) G.f |=  G_SCRIPT_AUTOEXEC;
00293         else G.f &= ~G_SCRIPT_AUTOEXEC;
00294     }
00295 
00296     /* update tempdir from user preferences */
00297     BLI_init_temporary_dir(U.tempdir);
00298 }

00301 
00302 /* return codes */
00303 #define BKE_READ_EXOTIC_FAIL_PATH       -3 /* file format is not supported */
00304 #define BKE_READ_EXOTIC_FAIL_FORMAT     -2 /* file format is not supported */
00305 #define BKE_READ_EXOTIC_FAIL_OPEN       -1 /* Can't open the file */
00306 #define BKE_READ_EXOTIC_OK_BLEND         0 /* .blend file */
00307 #define BKE_READ_EXOTIC_OK_OTHER         1 /* other supported formats */
00308 
00309 
00310 /* intended to check for non-blender formats but for now it only reads blends */
00311 static int wm_read_exotic(Scene *UNUSED(scene), const char *name)
00312 {
00313     int len;
00314     gzFile gzfile;
00315     char header[7];
00316     int retval;
00317 
00318     // make sure we're not trying to read a directory....
00319 
00320     len = strlen(name);
00321     if (ELEM(name[len - 1], '/', '\\')) {
00322         retval = BKE_READ_EXOTIC_FAIL_PATH;
00323     }
00324     else {
00325         gzfile = BLI_gzopen(name, "rb");
00326         if (gzfile == NULL) {
00327             retval = BKE_READ_EXOTIC_FAIL_OPEN;
00328         }
00329         else {
00330             len = gzread(gzfile, header, sizeof(header));
00331             gzclose(gzfile);
00332             if (len == sizeof(header) && strncmp(header, "BLENDER", 7) == 0) {
00333                 retval = BKE_READ_EXOTIC_OK_BLEND;
00334             }
00335             else {
00336                 //XXX waitcursor(1);
00337 #if 0           /* historic stuff - no longer used */
00338                 if (is_foo_format(name)) {
00339                     read_foo(name);
00340                     retval = BKE_READ_EXOTIC_OK_OTHER;
00341                 }
00342                 else
00343 #endif
00344                 {
00345                     retval = BKE_READ_EXOTIC_FAIL_FORMAT;
00346                 }
00347                 //XXX waitcursor(0);
00348             }
00349         }
00350     }
00351 
00352     return retval;
00353 }
00354 
00355 void WM_read_file(bContext *C, const char *filepath, ReportList *reports)
00356 {
00357     int retval;
00358 
00359     /* so we can get the error message */
00360     errno = 0;
00361 
00362     WM_cursor_wait(1);
00363 
00364     BLI_exec_cb(CTX_data_main(C), NULL, BLI_CB_EVT_LOAD_PRE);
00365 
00366     /* first try to append data from exotic file formats... */
00367     /* it throws error box when file doesn't exist and returns -1 */
00368     /* note; it should set some error message somewhere... (ton) */
00369     retval = wm_read_exotic(CTX_data_scene(C), filepath);
00370     
00371     /* we didn't succeed, now try to read Blender file */
00372     if (retval == BKE_READ_EXOTIC_OK_BLEND) {
00373         int G_f = G.f;
00374         ListBase wmbase;
00375 
00376         /* put aside screens to match with persistent windows later */
00377         /* also exit screens and editors */
00378         wm_window_match_init(C, &wmbase); 
00379         
00380         retval = BKE_read_file(C, filepath, reports);
00381         G.save_over = 1;
00382 
00383         /* this flag is initialized by the operator but overwritten on read.
00384          * need to re-enable it here else drivers + registered scripts wont work. */
00385         if (G.f != G_f) {
00386             const int flags_keep = (G_SCRIPT_AUTOEXEC | G_SCRIPT_OVERRIDE_PREF);
00387             G.f = (G.f & ~flags_keep) | (G_f & flags_keep);
00388         }
00389 
00390         /* match the read WM with current WM */
00391         wm_window_match_do(C, &wmbase);
00392         WM_check(C); /* opens window(s), checks keymaps */
00393         
00394 // XXX      mainwindow_set_filename_to_title(G.main->name);
00395 
00396         if (retval == BKE_READ_FILE_OK_USERPREFS) {
00397             /* in case a userdef is read from regular .blend */
00398             wm_init_userdef(C);
00399         }
00400         
00401         if (retval != BKE_READ_FILE_FAIL) {
00402             G.relbase_valid = 1;
00403             if (!G.background) /* assume automated tasks with background, don't write recent file list */
00404                 write_history();
00405         }
00406 
00407 
00408         WM_event_add_notifier(C, NC_WM | ND_FILEREAD, NULL);
00409 //      refresh_interface_font();
00410 
00411         CTX_wm_window_set(C, CTX_wm_manager(C)->windows.first);
00412 
00413         ED_editors_init(C);
00414         DAG_on_visible_update(CTX_data_main(C), TRUE);
00415 
00416 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON
00417         /* run any texts that were loaded in and flagged as modules */
00418         BPY_driver_reset();
00419         BPY_app_handlers_reset(FALSE);
00420         BPY_modules_load_user(C);
00421 #endif
00422 
00423         /* important to do before NULL'ing the context */
00424         BLI_exec_cb(CTX_data_main(C), NULL, BLI_CB_EVT_LOAD_POST);
00425 
00426         if (!G.background) {
00427             /* in background mode this makes it hard to load
00428              * a blend file and do anything since the screen
00429              * won't be set to a valid value again */
00430             CTX_wm_window_set(C, NULL); /* exits queues */
00431         }
00432 
00433 #if 0
00434         /* gives popups on windows but not linux, bug in report API
00435          * but disable for now to stop users getting annoyed  */
00436         /* TODO, make this show in header info window */
00437         {
00438             Scene *sce;
00439             for (sce = G.main->scene.first; sce; sce = sce->id.next) {
00440                 if (sce->r.engine[0] &&
00441                     BLI_findstring(&R_engines, sce->r.engine, offsetof(RenderEngineType, idname)) == NULL)
00442                 {
00443                     BKE_reportf(reports, RPT_WARNING,
00444                                 "Engine not available: '%s' for scene: %s, "
00445                                 "an addon may need to be installed or enabled",
00446                                 sce->r.engine, sce->id.name + 2);
00447                 }
00448             }
00449         }
00450 #endif
00451 
00452         // XXX      undo_editmode_clear();
00453         BKE_reset_undo();
00454         BKE_write_undo(C, "original");  /* save current state */
00455     }
00456     else if (retval == BKE_READ_EXOTIC_OK_OTHER)
00457         BKE_write_undo(C, "Import file");
00458     else if (retval == BKE_READ_EXOTIC_FAIL_OPEN) {
00459         BKE_reportf(reports, RPT_ERROR, IFACE_("Can't read file: \"%s\", %s."), filepath,
00460                     errno ? strerror(errno) : IFACE_("Unable to open the file"));
00461     }
00462     else if (retval == BKE_READ_EXOTIC_FAIL_FORMAT) {
00463         BKE_reportf(reports, RPT_ERROR, IFACE_("File format is not supported in file: \"%s\"."), filepath);
00464     }
00465     else if (retval == BKE_READ_EXOTIC_FAIL_PATH) {
00466         BKE_reportf(reports, RPT_ERROR, IFACE_("File path invalid: \"%s\"."), filepath);
00467     }
00468     else {
00469         BKE_reportf(reports, RPT_ERROR, IFACE_("Unknown error loading: \"%s\"."), filepath);
00470         BLI_assert(!"invalid 'retval'");
00471     }
00472 
00473     WM_cursor_wait(0);
00474 
00475 }

00478 /* called on startup,  (context entirely filled with NULLs) */
00479 /* or called for 'New File' */
00480 /* op can be NULL */
00481 int WM_read_homefile(bContext *C, ReportList *UNUSED(reports), short from_memory)
00482 {
00483     ListBase wmbase;
00484     char tstr[FILE_MAX];
00485     int success = 0;
00486     
00487     free_ttfont(); /* still weird... what does it here? */
00488         
00489     G.relbase_valid = 0;
00490     if (!from_memory) {
00491         char *cfgdir = BLI_get_folder(BLENDER_USER_CONFIG, NULL);
00492         if (cfgdir) {
00493             BLI_make_file_string(G.main->name, tstr, cfgdir, BLENDER_STARTUP_FILE);
00494         }
00495         else {
00496             tstr[0] = '\0';
00497             from_memory = 1;
00498         }
00499     }
00500     
00501     /* prevent loading no UI */
00502     G.fileflags &= ~G_FILE_NO_UI;
00503     
00504     /* put aside screens to match with persistent windows later */
00505     wm_window_match_init(C, &wmbase); 
00506     
00507     if (!from_memory && BLI_exists(tstr)) {
00508         success = (BKE_read_file(C, tstr, NULL) != BKE_READ_FILE_FAIL);
00509         
00510         if (U.themes.first == NULL) {
00511             printf("\nError: No valid "STRINGIFY (BLENDER_STARTUP_FILE)", fall back to built-in default.\n\n");
00512             success = 0;
00513         }
00514     }
00515     if (success == 0) {
00516         success = BKE_read_file_from_memory(C, datatoc_startup_blend, datatoc_startup_blend_size, NULL);
00517         if (wmbase.first == NULL) wm_clear_default_size(C);
00518 
00519 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON_SECURITY /* not default */
00520         /* use alternative setting for security nuts
00521          * otherwise we'd need to patch the binary blob - startup.blend.c */
00522         U.flag |= USER_SCRIPT_AUTOEXEC_DISABLE;
00523 #endif
00524     }
00525     
00526     /* prevent buggy files that had G_FILE_RELATIVE_REMAP written out by mistake. Screws up autosaves otherwise
00527      * can remove this eventually, only in a 2.53 and older, now its not written */
00528     G.fileflags &= ~G_FILE_RELATIVE_REMAP;
00529     
00530     /* check userdef before open window, keymaps etc */
00531     wm_init_userdef(C);
00532     
00533     /* match the read WM with current WM */
00534     wm_window_match_do(C, &wmbase); 
00535     WM_check(C); /* opens window(s), checks keymaps */
00536 
00537     G.main->name[0] = '\0';
00538 
00539     /* When loading factory settings, the reset solid OpenGL lights need to be applied. */
00540     if (!G.background) GPU_default_lights();
00541     
00542     /* XXX */
00543     G.save_over = 0;    // start with save preference untitled.blend
00544     G.fileflags &= ~G_FILE_AUTOPLAY;    /*  disable autoplay in startup.blend... */
00545 //  mainwindow_set_filename_to_title("");   // empty string re-initializes title to "Blender"
00546     
00547 //  refresh_interface_font();
00548     
00549 //  undo_editmode_clear();
00550     BKE_reset_undo();
00551     BKE_write_undo(C, "original");  /* save current state */
00552 
00553     ED_editors_init(C);
00554     DAG_on_visible_update(CTX_data_main(C), TRUE);
00555 
00556 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON
00557     if (CTX_py_init_get(C)) {
00558         /* sync addons, these may have changed from the defaults */
00559         BPY_string_exec(C, "__import__('addon_utils').reset_all()");
00560 
00561         BPY_driver_reset();
00562         BPY_app_handlers_reset(FALSE);
00563         BPY_modules_load_user(C);
00564     }
00565 #endif
00566 
00567     WM_event_add_notifier(C, NC_WM | ND_FILEREAD, NULL);
00568 
00569     /* in background mode the scene will stay NULL */
00570     if (!G.background) {
00571         CTX_wm_window_set(C, NULL); /* exits queues */
00572     }
00573 
00574     return TRUE;
00575 }
00576 
00577 int WM_read_homefile_exec(bContext *C, wmOperator *op)
00578 {
00579     int from_memory = strcmp(op->type->idname, "WM_OT_read_factory_settings") == 0;
00580     return WM_read_homefile(C, op->reports, from_memory) ? OPERATOR_FINISHED : OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00581 }
00582 
00583 void WM_read_history(void)
00584 {
00585     char name[FILE_MAX];
00586     LinkNode *l, *lines;
00587     struct RecentFile *recent;
00588     char *line;
00589     int num;
00590     char *cfgdir = BLI_get_folder(BLENDER_USER_CONFIG, NULL);
00591 
00592     if (!cfgdir) return;
00593 
00594     BLI_make_file_string("/", name, cfgdir, BLENDER_HISTORY_FILE);
00595 
00596     lines = BLI_file_read_as_lines(name);
00597 
00598     G.recent_files.first = G.recent_files.last = NULL;
00599 
00600     /* read list of recent opened files from recent-files.txt to memory */
00601     for (l = lines, num = 0; l && (num < U.recent_files); l = l->next) {
00602         line = l->link;
00603         if (line[0] && BLI_exists(line)) {
00604             recent = (RecentFile *)MEM_mallocN(sizeof(RecentFile), "RecentFile");
00605             BLI_addtail(&(G.recent_files), recent);
00606             recent->filepath = BLI_strdup(line);
00607             num++;
00608         }
00609     }
00610     
00611     BLI_file_free_lines(lines);
00612 
00613 }
00614 
00615 static void write_history(void)
00616 {
00617     struct RecentFile *recent, *next_recent;
00618     char name[FILE_MAX];
00619     char *user_config_dir;
00620     FILE *fp;
00621     int i;
00622 
00623     /* will be NULL in background mode */
00624     user_config_dir = BLI_get_folder_create(BLENDER_USER_CONFIG, NULL);
00625     if (!user_config_dir)
00626         return;
00627 
00628     BLI_make_file_string("/", name, user_config_dir, BLENDER_HISTORY_FILE);
00629 
00630     recent = G.recent_files.first;
00631     /* refresh recent-files.txt of recent opened files, when current file was changed */
00632     if (!(recent) || (BLI_path_cmp(recent->filepath, G.main->name) != 0)) {
00633         fp = BLI_fopen(name, "w");
00634         if (fp) {
00635             /* add current file to the beginning of list */
00636             recent = (RecentFile *)MEM_mallocN(sizeof(RecentFile), "RecentFile");
00637             recent->filepath = BLI_strdup(G.main->name);
00638             BLI_addhead(&(G.recent_files), recent);
00639             /* write current file to recent-files.txt */
00640             fprintf(fp, "%s\n", recent->filepath);
00641             recent = recent->next;
00642             i = 1;
00643             /* write rest of recent opened files to recent-files.txt */
00644             while ((i < U.recent_files) && (recent)) {
00645                 /* this prevents to have duplicities in list */
00646                 if (BLI_path_cmp(recent->filepath, G.main->name) != 0) {
00647                     fprintf(fp, "%s\n", recent->filepath);
00648                     recent = recent->next;
00649                 }
00650                 else {
00651                     next_recent = recent->next;
00652                     MEM_freeN(recent->filepath);
00653                     BLI_freelinkN(&(G.recent_files), recent);
00654                     recent = next_recent;
00655                 }
00656                 i++;
00657             }
00658             fclose(fp);
00659         }
00660 
00661         /* also update most recent files on System */
00662         GHOST_addToSystemRecentFiles(G.main->name);
00663     }
00664 }
00665 
00666 /* screen can be NULL */
00667 static ImBuf *blend_file_thumb(Scene *scene, bScreen *screen, int **thumb_pt)
00668 {
00669     /* will be scaled down, but gives some nice oversampling */
00670     ImBuf *ibuf;
00671     int *thumb;
00672     char err_out[256] = "unknown";
00673 
00674     /* screen if no camera found */
00675     ScrArea *sa = NULL;
00676     ARegion *ar = NULL;
00677     View3D *v3d = NULL;
00678 
00679     *thumb_pt = NULL;
00680 
00681     /* scene can be NULL if running a script at startup and calling the save operator */
00682     if (G.background || scene == NULL)
00683         return NULL;
00684 
00685     if ((scene->camera == NULL) && (screen != NULL)) {
00686         sa = BKE_screen_find_big_area(screen, SPACE_VIEW3D, 0);
00687         ar = BKE_area_find_region_type(sa, RGN_TYPE_WINDOW);
00688         if (ar) {
00689             v3d = sa->spacedata.first;
00690         }
00691     }
00692 
00693     if (scene->camera == NULL && v3d == NULL) {
00694         return NULL;
00695     }
00696 
00697     /* gets scaled to BLEN_THUMB_SIZE */
00698     if (scene->camera) {
00699         ibuf = ED_view3d_draw_offscreen_imbuf_simple(scene, scene->camera,
00700                                                      BLEN_THUMB_SIZE * 2, BLEN_THUMB_SIZE * 2,
00701                                                      IB_rect, OB_SOLID, FALSE, err_out);
00702     }
00703     else {
00704         ibuf = ED_view3d_draw_offscreen_imbuf(scene, v3d, ar, BLEN_THUMB_SIZE * 2, BLEN_THUMB_SIZE * 2,
00705                                               IB_rect, FALSE, err_out);
00706     }
00707 
00708     if (ibuf) {     
00709         float aspect = (scene->r.xsch * scene->r.xasp) / (scene->r.ysch * scene->r.yasp);
00710 
00711         /* dirty oversampling */
00712         IMB_scaleImBuf(ibuf, BLEN_THUMB_SIZE, BLEN_THUMB_SIZE);
00713 
00714         /* add pretty overlay */
00715         IMB_overlayblend_thumb(ibuf->rect, ibuf->x, ibuf->y, aspect);
00716         
00717         /* first write into thumb buffer */
00718         thumb = MEM_mallocN(((2 + (BLEN_THUMB_SIZE * BLEN_THUMB_SIZE))) * sizeof(int), "write_file thumb");
00719 
00720         thumb[0] = BLEN_THUMB_SIZE;
00721         thumb[1] = BLEN_THUMB_SIZE;
00722 
00723         memcpy(thumb + 2, ibuf->rect, BLEN_THUMB_SIZE * BLEN_THUMB_SIZE * sizeof(int));
00724     }
00725     else {
00726         /* '*thumb_pt' needs to stay NULL to prevent a bad thumbnail from being handled */
00727         fprintf(stderr, "blend_file_thumb failed to create thumbnail: %s\n", err_out);
00728         thumb = NULL;
00729     }
00730     
00731     /* must be freed by caller */
00732     *thumb_pt = thumb;
00733     
00734     return ibuf;
00735 }
00736 
00737 /* easy access from gdb */
00738 int write_crash_blend(void)
00739 {
00740     char path[FILE_MAX];
00741     int fileflags = G.fileflags & ~(G_FILE_HISTORY); /* don't do file history on crash file */
00742 
00743     BLI_strncpy(path, G.main->name, sizeof(path));
00744     BLI_replace_extension(path, sizeof(path), "_crash.blend");
00745     if (BLO_write_file(G.main, path, fileflags, NULL, NULL)) {
00746         printf("written: %s\n", path);
00747         return 1;
00748     }
00749     else {
00750         printf("failed: %s\n", path);
00751         return 0;
00752     }
00753 }
00754 
00755 int WM_write_file(bContext *C, const char *target, int fileflags, ReportList *reports, int copy)
00756 {
00757     Library *li;
00758     int len;
00759     char filepath[FILE_MAX];
00760 
00761     int *thumb = NULL;
00762     ImBuf *ibuf_thumb = NULL;
00763 
00764     len = strlen(target);
00765     
00766     if (len == 0) {
00767         BKE_report(reports, RPT_ERROR, "Path is empty, cannot save");
00768         return -1;
00769     }
00770 
00771     if (len >= FILE_MAX) {
00772         BKE_report(reports, RPT_ERROR, "Path too long, cannot save");
00773         return -1;
00774     }
00775  
00776     BLI_strncpy(filepath, target, FILE_MAX);
00777     BLI_replace_extension(filepath, FILE_MAX, ".blend");
00778     /* don't use 'target' anymore */
00779     
00780     /* send the OnSave event */
00781     for (li = G.main->library.first; li; li = li->id.next) {
00782         if (BLI_path_cmp(li->filepath, filepath) == 0) {
00783             BKE_reportf(reports, RPT_ERROR, "Can't overwrite used library '%.240s'", filepath);
00784             return -1;
00785         }
00786     }
00787 
00788     /* blend file thumbnail */
00789     /* save before exit_editmode, otherwise derivedmeshes for shared data corrupt #27765) */
00790     if (U.flag & USER_SAVE_PREVIEWS) {
00791         ibuf_thumb = blend_file_thumb(CTX_data_scene(C), CTX_wm_screen(C), &thumb);
00792     }
00793 
00794     BLI_exec_cb(G.main, NULL, BLI_CB_EVT_SAVE_PRE);
00795 
00796     /* operator now handles overwrite checks */
00797 
00798     if (G.fileflags & G_AUTOPACK) {
00799         packAll(G.main, reports);
00800     }
00801     
00802     ED_object_exit_editmode(C, EM_DO_UNDO);
00803     ED_sculpt_force_update(C);
00804 
00805     /* don't forget not to return without! */
00806     WM_cursor_wait(1);
00807     
00808     fileflags |= G_FILE_HISTORY; /* write file history */
00809 
00810     if (BLO_write_file(CTX_data_main(C), filepath, fileflags, reports, thumb)) {
00811         if (!copy) {
00812             G.relbase_valid = 1;
00813             BLI_strncpy(G.main->name, filepath, sizeof(G.main->name));  /* is guaranteed current file */
00814     
00815             G.save_over = 1; /* disable untitled.blend convention */
00816         }
00817 
00818         if (fileflags & G_FILE_COMPRESS) G.fileflags |= G_FILE_COMPRESS;
00819         else G.fileflags &= ~G_FILE_COMPRESS;
00820         
00821         if (fileflags & G_FILE_AUTOPLAY) G.fileflags |= G_FILE_AUTOPLAY;
00822         else G.fileflags &= ~G_FILE_AUTOPLAY;
00823 
00824         /* prevent background mode scripts from clobbering history */
00825         if (!G.background) {
00826             write_history();
00827         }
00828 
00829         BLI_exec_cb(G.main, NULL, BLI_CB_EVT_SAVE_POST);
00830 
00831         /* run this function after because the file cant be written before the blend is */
00832         if (ibuf_thumb) {
00833             IMB_thumb_delete(filepath, THB_FAIL); /* without this a failed thumb overrides */
00834             ibuf_thumb = IMB_thumb_create(filepath, THB_NORMAL, THB_SOURCE_BLEND, ibuf_thumb);
00835             IMB_freeImBuf(ibuf_thumb);
00836         }
00837 
00838         if (thumb) MEM_freeN(thumb);
00839     }
00840     else {
00841         if (ibuf_thumb) IMB_freeImBuf(ibuf_thumb);
00842         if (thumb) MEM_freeN(thumb);
00843         
00844         WM_cursor_wait(0);
00845         return -1;
00846     }
00847 
00848     WM_cursor_wait(0);
00849     
00850     return 0;
00851 }
00852 
00853 /* operator entry */
00854 int WM_write_homefile(bContext *C, wmOperator *op)
00855 {
00856     wmWindowManager *wm = CTX_wm_manager(C);
00857     wmWindow *win = CTX_wm_window(C);
00858     char filepath[FILE_MAX];
00859     int fileflags;
00860 
00861     /* check current window and close it if temp */
00862     if (win->screen->temp)
00863         wm_window_close(C, wm, win);
00864     
00865     /* update keymaps in user preferences */
00866     WM_keyconfig_update(wm);
00867     
00868     BLI_make_file_string("/", filepath, BLI_get_folder_create(BLENDER_USER_CONFIG, NULL), BLENDER_STARTUP_FILE);
00869     printf("trying to save homefile at %s ", filepath);
00870     
00871     /*  force save as regular blend file */
00872     fileflags = G.fileflags & ~(G_FILE_COMPRESS | G_FILE_AUTOPLAY | G_FILE_LOCK | G_FILE_SIGN | G_FILE_HISTORY);
00873 
00874     if (BLO_write_file(CTX_data_main(C), filepath, fileflags, op->reports, NULL) == 0) {
00875         printf("fail\n");
00876         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00877     }
00878     
00879     printf("ok\n");
00880 
00881     G.save_over = 0;
00882 
00883     return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
00884 }
00885 
00886 /************************ autosave ****************************/
00887 
00888 void wm_autosave_location(char *filepath)
00889 {
00890     char pidstr[32];
00891 #ifdef WIN32
00892     char *savedir;
00893 #endif
00894 
00895     BLI_snprintf(pidstr, sizeof(pidstr), "%d.blend", abs(getpid()));
00896 
00897 #ifdef WIN32
00898     /* XXX Need to investigate how to handle default location of '/tmp/'
00899      * This is a relative directory on Windows, and it may be
00900      * found. Example:
00901      * Blender installed on D:\ drive, D:\ drive has D:\tmp\
00902      * Now, BLI_exists() will find '/tmp/' exists, but
00903      * BLI_make_file_string will create string that has it most likely on C:\
00904      * through get_default_root().
00905      * If there is no C:\tmp autosave fails. */
00906     if (!BLI_exists(BLI_temporary_dir())) {
00907         savedir = BLI_get_folder_create(BLENDER_USER_AUTOSAVE, NULL);
00908         BLI_make_file_string("/", filepath, savedir, pidstr);
00909         return;
00910     }
00911 #endif
00912 
00913     BLI_make_file_string("/", filepath, BLI_temporary_dir(), pidstr);
00914 }
00915 
00916 void WM_autosave_init(wmWindowManager *wm)
00917 {
00918     wm_autosave_timer_ended(wm);
00919 
00920     if (U.flag & USER_AUTOSAVE)
00921         wm->autosavetimer = WM_event_add_timer(wm, NULL, TIMERAUTOSAVE, U.savetime * 60.0);
00922 }
00923 
00924 void wm_autosave_timer(const bContext *C, wmWindowManager *wm, wmTimer *UNUSED(wt))
00925 {
00926     wmWindow *win;
00927     wmEventHandler *handler;
00928     char filepath[FILE_MAX];
00929     int fileflags;
00930 
00931     WM_event_remove_timer(wm, NULL, wm->autosavetimer);
00932 
00933     /* if a modal operator is running, don't autosave, but try again in 10 seconds */
00934     for (win = wm->windows.first; win; win = win->next) {
00935         for (handler = win->modalhandlers.first; handler; handler = handler->next) {
00936             if (handler->op) {
00937                 wm->autosavetimer = WM_event_add_timer(wm, NULL, TIMERAUTOSAVE, 10.0);
00938                 return;
00939             }
00940         }
00941     }
00942     
00943     wm_autosave_location(filepath);
00944 
00945     /*  force save as regular blend file */
00946     fileflags = G.fileflags & ~(G_FILE_COMPRESS | G_FILE_AUTOPLAY | G_FILE_LOCK | G_FILE_SIGN | G_FILE_HISTORY);
00947 
00948     /* no error reporting to console */
00949     BLO_write_file(CTX_data_main(C), filepath, fileflags, NULL, NULL);
00950 
00951     /* do timer after file write, just in case file write takes a long time */
00952     wm->autosavetimer = WM_event_add_timer(wm, NULL, TIMERAUTOSAVE, U.savetime * 60.0);
00953 }
00954 
00955 void wm_autosave_timer_ended(wmWindowManager *wm)
00956 {
00957     if (wm->autosavetimer) {
00958         WM_event_remove_timer(wm, NULL, wm->autosavetimer);
00959         wm->autosavetimer = NULL;
00960     }
00961 }
00962 
00963 void wm_autosave_delete(void)
00964 {
00965     char filename[FILE_MAX];
00966     
00967     wm_autosave_location(filename);
00968 
00969     if (BLI_exists(filename)) {
00970         char str[FILE_MAX];
00971         BLI_make_file_string("/", str, BLI_temporary_dir(), "quit.blend");
00972 
00973         /* if global undo; remove tempsave, otherwise rename */
00974         if (U.uiflag & USER_GLOBALUNDO) BLI_delete(filename, 0, 0);
00975         else BLI_rename(filename, str);
00976     }
00977 }
00978 
00979 void wm_autosave_read(bContext *C, ReportList *reports)
00980 {
00981     char filename[FILE_MAX];
00982 
00983     wm_autosave_location(filename);
00984     WM_read_file(C, filename, reports);
00985 }
